Class WindowPanel

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventPreview, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasAnimation, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasCaption, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesPopupEvents, java.lang.Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, HasLayoutManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
MessageBox
public class WindowPanel
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.DecoratedPopupPanel
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasCaption, HasLayoutManager

A DecoratedPopupPanel that has a caption area at the top and can be dragged and resized by the user. The default layout for a window is FillLayout.

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com

bringToFront

public void bringToFront()
Deprecated. Replaced by toFront().

If this WindowPanel is visible, brings this WindowPanel to the front.

center

public void center()
Centers the WindowPanel in the browser window and shows it ( centers the popup in the browser window by adding it to the RootPanel). The layout() is called after the WindowPanel is attached (in onLoad()). If the WindowPanel was already showing, then the WindowPanel is centered. If the WindowPanel is set to not visible by calling PopupPanel.setVisible(boolean) before show() the WindowPanel will be attached and visible (not like show()).

Overrides:
center in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel
See Also:
show()

close

public void close()
Deprecated. Replaced by PopupPanel.hide()

Close the window panel.

getWindowState

public WindowPanel.WindowState getWindowState()
Gets the flag that determines the state of the window panel. Default is 'NORMAL' (ie not MINIMIZED or MAXIMIZED).

hide

public void hide(boolean autoHide)
Hides the WindowPanel (hides the popup by removing it from the RootPanel). This has no effect if it is not currently visible.

Overrides:
hide in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel
Parameters:
autoClosed - the value that will be passed to PopupListener.onPopupClosed(PopupPanel, boolean) when the popup is closed
See Also:
PopupPanel.hide()

pack

public void pack()
Causes this WindowPanel to be sized to fit the preferred size and layouts of its subcomponents. The layout() method is called after the preferred size is calculated.

setWindowState

public void setWindowState(WindowPanel.WindowState windowState)
Sets the flag to determine the state of the window panel. Default is 'NORMAL' (ie not MINIMIZED or MAXIMIZED).

Parameters:
windowState - the flag to determine the state of the window panel

show

public void show()
Makes the WindowPanel visible (shows the popup by adding it to the RootPanel). The layout() is called after the WindowPanel is attached (in onLoad()). If the WindowPanel is already attached, this will bring the WindowPanel to the front. If the WindowPanel is set to not visible by calling PopupPanel.setVisible(boolean) before show() the WindowPanel will be attached but not visible.

Overrides:
show in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel
See Also:
center(), pack(), PopupPanel.setPopupPositionAndShow(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel.PositionCallback), showModal()

showModal

public void showModal()
Centers the WindowPanel in the browser window and shows it modal (centers the popup in the browser window by adding it to the RootPanel and displays a com.google.gwt.widgetideas.client.GlassPanel under it). The layout() is called after the WindowPanel is attached (in onLoad()). If the WindowPanel is already attached, then the WindowPanel is centered. If the WindowPanel is set to not visible by calling PopupPanel.setVisible(boolean) before show() the WindowPanel will be attached and visible (not like show()).

See Also:
center(), isModal()

toBack

public void toBack()
If this WindowPanel is visible, sends this WindowPanel to the back.

Places this WindowPanel at the bottom of the stacking order and shows it behind any other WindowPanels.

See Also:
toFront()

toFront

public void toFront()
If this WindowPanel is visible, brings this WindowPanel to the front.

Places this WindowPanel at the top of the stacking order and shows it in front of any other WindowPanels.

See Also:
toBack()
